name: go2sublime
body:
![cool gif that shows how to install and use it](https://33.media.tumblr.com/bee0d15e8a3e9a00bdd8eb221500112e/tumblr_ns32b5gOTM1t86pqso1_540.gif)

A button to open sublime on the current folder on Finder. Trust me you need it.

### Installation
1. [Download](https://github.com/mrkev/go2sublime/releases/download/0.0.0/go2sublime.app.zip) and unzip.
1. While holding command, drag the app to the Finder toolbar.
1. Enjoy!

### Questions?
[Ask](http://thatkevin.tk/ask)

_This app was inspired by the excellent [go2shell](http://zipzapmac.com/Go2Shell). Check it out! They go great together._
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
